creator: gregor.huc@siemens.com
text:
If in a SVG file is a text tag with the font-family "Symbol" it will be not 
correctly transform to JPG, eg:
<text transform="matrix(1 0 0 1 375.115 575.623)" 
style="stroke:none;fill:#000000;font-family:'Symbol';font-
size:15.035;">®</text> correctly it have to be a arrow to right but in the jpg 
it is a "®"

creator: gregor.huc@siemens.com
text:
Created attachment 21397
The appendant SVG file

The source SVG with a text tag with the font "Symbol"

Comment on attachment 21397
The appendant SVG file

Please view in the adobe svg viewer 3.03. In the Batik viewer it will not
correctly show too
creator: gregor.huc@siemens.com
vhennebert@gmail.com
text:
In my opinion Batik and FOP are correct, and it's the Adobe viewer that is at
fault here. The character put in the svg file actually is the registered
trademark (®). So FOP/Batik try to find the suitable glyph and appear to
find one.
If you want an arrow you should put the arrow character, either entering it
directly or by using the corresponding entity: →. I tested and it works.

Closing the bug as invalid, but feel free to re-open it if you think I'm wrong.

Oops, I thought I was on the FOP bugzilla... Still, the bug may be resolved as
invalid I think.
creator: vhennebert@gmail.com
